Run Monte Carlo Simulation For Single Condition

Source: R/run.R
run_condition.Rd

run_condition() runs a Monte Carlo simulation for a single given condition. It generates data based on the pop_synt element in "object", and estimates an RI-CLPM using the est_synt element in "object". Data generation and model estimation are done using lavaan.

Usage

run_condition(object, p)

Arguments

object

A list with information for running a single simulation condition. See "Details" for an overview of the elements this object must contain.

p

A progressr object

Value

A list.

Details

Input: Elements in "object"

To successfully run a Monte Carlo simulation, the "object" arguments needs the following elements:

  • sample_size: The sample size.

  • time_points: The number of time points.

  • reps: Number of replications.

  • pop_synt: lavaan model syntax containing population values for data generation.

  • pop_tab: lavaan parameter table for data generation.

  • est_synt: lavaan model syntax for estimation.

  • est_tab: lavaan parameter table for estimation.

  • skewness: The skewness value(s) for the observed variables.

  • kurtosis: The kurtosis value(s) for the observed variables.

  • alpha: The significance criterion.

  • save_path: Folder to which simulated data are saved (optional).

Output

This function adds the following elements to "object":

  • results: A data frame containing the results (i.e., population values, bias, standard error of the estimate, coverage, power, etc.),

  • errors: A logical vector denoting failed Monte Carlo replications,

  • not_converged: A logical vector denoting non-converged Monte Carlo replications, and

  • inadmissible A logical vector denoting Monte Carlo replications that resulted in negative variances or non-positive definite matrices.
